result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lorn M. Blacker

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Cover Letter from Atty. Hart for reset

1:50 PM Defendant Lorn M. Blacker in court.  Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews financial information.  Court finds conditionally indigent.  Court appoints Attorney Taylor Hart, 620 8th Avenue, Baraboo, WI 53913 (608) 355-2000 @$100/hr and reimbursement @ $250.00/month commencing September 15, 2022.  Matter reset.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Indigency hearing on August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency
Maintain Absolute Sobriety. Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.

2:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Michael X. Albrecht and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lorn M. Blacker appeared by video from LEC, in custody, with atty. Markoski. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE does not qualify for PD representation.  Advised of rights to an attorney. State requests $1000.00 CASH Bond. Atty. Markoski makes bail argument for signature bond.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $2500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return date scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on August 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
